solution_line_template: The age difference between Beth and her sister is {beth_age} - {sister_age} = <<{beth_age}-{sister_age}={age_difference}>>{age_difference} years.
Beth must be {age_difference} x {multiplier} = <<{age_difference}*{multiplier}={beth_twice_age}>>{beth_twice_age} to be twice her sister's age.
Beth will be twice her sister's age in {beth_twice_age} - {beth_age} = <<{beth_twice_age}-{beth_age}={years_until_twice}>>{years_until_twice} years.
